name: Madison Square Garden
description: The 'World's Most Famous Arena' and the spiritual home of sports entertainment. Every legend has walked these hallowed halls.

name: Tokyo Dome
description: The massive 'Big Egg'. Host to the largest spectacles in Japanese wrestling history, where the atmosphere is both respectful and electric.

name: Arena México
description: The 'Cathedral of Lucha Libre'. A place of high-flying tradition, colorful masks, and deep-rooted cultural pride.

name: Wembley Stadium
description: A gargantuan open-air stadium in London. When it's full for a wrestling event, the roar of the crowd is deafening.

name: Allstate Arena
description: A legendary arena in the Chicago area known for having one of the loudest and most opinionated crowds in the world.

name: Korakuen Hall
description: Known as the 'Holy Ground' of Japanese wrestling. A smaller, intimate venue where every strike and slam echoes throughout the building.

name: Hammerstein Ballroom
description: A historic NYC ballroom with tiered balconies that create a unique vertical atmosphere, famous for its hardcore history.

name: Scotiabank Arena
description: A premier multi-purpose arena in downtown Toronto, host to some of the biggest events in North American wrestling history.

name: Smoothie King Center
description: A top-tier arena in New Orleans, known for its incredible atmosphere during major championship events.

name: EDION Arena Osaka
description: Formerly known as Osaka Prefectural Gymnasium, it is a staple for major Japanese wrestling tournaments.

name: Accor Arena
description: A modern, multi-purpose arena in Paris that has become the premier destination for major international wrestling tours in France.

name: Neon Serpent Dome
description: A dazzling, multi-tiered arena in Neo-Tokyo, famous for its holographic displays and an electrifying atmosphere.

name: The Steel Citadel
description: A massive, industrial-themed arena in the heart of Pittsburgh. Home to the most technically sound fans in the world.

name: Oda Clan Fortress
description: A high-tech, yakuza-controlled arena in the Osaka Cyber-District. The crowd is intensely loyal to the Oda legacy.

name: The Frozen Peak
description: A state-of-the-art cryo-arena in Winnipeg. Known for its 'chilly' reception to outsiders and explosive atmosphere.

name: Lion's Roar Sanctuary
description: A majestic arena built along the Zambezi River, combining ancient aesthetics with 23rd-century energy technology.

name: The Epic of Uruk
description: A breathtaking reconstruction of the ancient Mesopotamian city, serving as a massive open-air wrestling complex.

name: Frost-Bite Octagon
description: A brutal, sub-zero fighting cage in the Siberian Outpost. Only the most battle-hardened survive here.

name: Jaguar's Sun-Stone Plaza
description: A massive megaplex in Mexico City, celebrating the rich history of Lucha Libre with cutting-edge holographic masks.

name: The Palace of Slam
description: The personal playground of Johnny All Time. It's more of a high-end nightclub and parkour course than a traditional arena.

name: Royal Bulldog Hall
description: A prestigious arena in Neo-London, preserving the grit and glory of British wrestling tradition.

name: Grand Palace Gardens
description: An elegant arena floating above Neo-Paris, where matches are treated as a high-society art form.

name: Zero-G Octagon
description: A cutting-edge arena on Lunar Colony Alpha, where gravity projectors can be manipulated for unique match physics.

name: Canopy Combat Cage
description: A spectacular cage arena suspended high above the Amazon jungle floor, integrated into the massive Bio-Trees.

name: Aqua Colosseum
description: An exquisite underwater arena in Atlantis Reborn, with transparent domes offering views of marine life.

name: Optus Stadium
description: A massive state-of-the-art stadium in Perth, configured for a deafening wall of sound during international spectacles.

name: Melbourne Cricket Ground
description: The 'G'. A legendary, gargantuan stadium capable of holding over 100,000 screaming fans for the biggest events on the planet.

name: Rod Laver Arena
description: A premier indoor arena in Melbourne, known for its intense atmosphere and proximity of the fans to the ring.

name: Coliseo de Puerto Rico
description: The 'Choliseo'. The crown jewel of Puerto Rican wrestling, where the fans are among the most passionate in the world.

name: Estadio Hiram Bithorn
description: A historic open-air stadium in San Juan, legendary for hosting massive championship battles under the Caribbean stars.

name: Mohammed Abdo Arena
description: A high-production multi-purpose arena in Riyadh, part of the glittering Boulevard City complex.

name: Jeddah Super Dome
description: The largest geodesic dome in the world, a massive and visually stunning marvel of engineering in Jeddah.

name: Kingdom Arena
description: A spectacular, state-of-the-art indoor stadium in Riyadh designed for the ultimate spectator experience.

name: AT&T Stadium
description: A colossal stadium in Dallas, Texas, famous for its massive jumbotron and hosting record-breaking wrestling events.

name: Allegiant Stadium
description: The 'Death Star' of Las Vegas, a sleek, modern stadium built for mega-events and high-octane entertainment.

name: Ford Field
description: A domed stadium in Detroit, known for its loud crowds and a passionate local fanbase that brings the intensity.

name: SoFi Stadium
description: An architectural marvel in Los Angeles, designed for grand spectacles and a luxurious fan experience.

name: NRG Stadium
description: A massive multi-purpose stadium in Houston, a frequent host of major wrestling events with a Texas-sized atmosphere.

name: Camping World Stadium
description: A large outdoor stadium in Orlando, known for its vibrant, family-friendly atmosphere during major events.

name: Raymond James Stadium
description: A Buccaneers-themed stadium in Tampa, host to historic wrestling main events under the Florida sun.

name: MetLife Stadium
description: A sprawling outdoor stadium in East Rutherford, just outside NYC, built for the biggest events imaginable.

name: Hard Rock Stadium
description: A lively outdoor stadium in Miami, known for its festive atmosphere and high-energy crowd.

name: Levi's Stadium
description: A modern, high-tech stadium in Santa Clara, representing the cutting edge of sports and entertainment venues.

name: Nissan Stadium
description: A prominent outdoor stadium in Nashville, blending the city's musical heritage with a passionate sports culture.

name: Indira Gandhi Arena
description: A massive indoor arena in Delhi, capable of hosting grand-scale wrestling events for a passionate Indian audience.

name: Allianz Parque
description: A modern multi-purpose arena in São Paulo, featuring a vibrant atmosphere and a passionate Brazilian fanbase.

name: TD Garden
description: A classic indoor arena in Boston, known for its intimate feel and a raucous, knowledgeable wrestling crowd.

name: Wells Fargo Center
description: A premier indoor arena in Philadelphia, a city with a deep-rooted history of hardcore wrestling and passionate fans.

name: Bell Centre
description: A state-of-the-art arena in Montreal, host to some of the most memorable wrestling events in Canadian history.

name: Rogers Place
description: A modern, sleek arena in Edmonton, providing a fantastic fan experience for major wrestling shows.

name: AO Arena
description: A large indoor arena in Manchester, UK, known for its loud and lively atmosphere during wrestling events.

name: OVO Hydro
description: A prominent arena in Glasgow, Scotland, hosting major concerts and wrestling shows with a famously vocal Scottish crowd.

name: Osaka-Jo Hall
description: A historic multi-purpose arena in Osaka, Japan, a staple for major New Japan Pro-Wrestling events.

name: Fukuoka Dome
description: A large domed stadium in Fukuoka, Japan, capable of hosting grand-scale wrestling events with a unique atmosphere.

name: Arena Monterrey
description: A modern, versatile arena in Monterrey, Mexico, a popular venue for Lucha Libre and international wrestling tours.

name: Arena Coliseo de Guadalajara
description: A traditional Lucha Libre arena in Guadalajara, known for its intimate setting and passionate, vocal fanbase.

name: Mercedes-Benz Arena (Berlin)
description: A modern multi-purpose arena in Berlin, Germany, a key venue for the growing European wrestling scene.

name: Barclays Arena (Hamburg)
description: A large indoor arena in Hamburg, Germany, hosting major sporting and entertainment events, including wrestling.

name: Ziggo Dome
description: A state-of-the-art concert and events arena in Amsterdam, a new destination for international wrestling shows.

name: Ahoy Arena
description: A multi-purpose indoor arena in Rotterdam, Netherlands, known for its enthusiastic sports crowds.

name: SSE Arena Belfast
description: A prominent arena in Belfast, Northern Ireland, hosting major wrestling events with a fierce local following.

name: Utilita Arena Birmingham
description: A large indoor arena in Birmingham, UK, a key venue for national and international wrestling tours.

name: Utilita Arena Newcastle
description: A popular indoor arena in Newcastle, UK, known for its lively crowds and high-energy atmosphere.

name: Echo Arena (Liverpool)
description: A modern arena on the Liverpool waterfront, hosting major events with enthusiastic Scouse fans.

name: 3Arena
description: A major indoor arena in Dublin, Ireland, a popular stop for international wrestling promotions.

name: Underground Brawlers Pit
description: A repurposed, grimy industrial space in NYC, host to underground, hardcore wrestling bouts.

name: Abandoned Warehouse Brawl
description: A desolate warehouse in Chicago, used for unsanctioned, no-holds-barred fights where rules are nonexistent.

name: Pixel Palace Arcade
description: A vibrant, retro-futuristic arcade repurposed for high-energy, fast-paced wrestling in Neo-Tokyo.

name: Jungle Coliseum
description: An open-air arena carved into the dense Amazon jungle, where nature provides a wild, unpredictable backdrop.

name: Ice Breaker Arena
description: A brutal, ice-themed fighting arena deep within the Siberian Outpost, designed for extreme, punishing matches.

name: WrestleDome Expo
description: A dazzling convention center transformed into a wrestling arena in Las Vegas, a showcase for unique and extravagant talent.

name: Gladiator Gauntlet
description: A modern recreation of an ancient Roman coliseum, hosting brutal, epic battles in a new Rome.

name: Lunar Colosseum
description: A vast, domed arena on Lunar Colony Alpha, where low-gravity matches become an ethereal spectacle.

name: Deep Sea Grand Arena
description: A breathtaking underwater arena in Atlantis Reborn, where matches are observed through transparent domes revealing marine life.

name: Amazonian Sky Bowl
description: An open-air arena suspended high within the giant Bio-Trees of the Amazonian Canopy-City, blending nature with technology.

name: Ironclad Arena
description: A brutal, no-frills arena located in a repurposed factory in Detroit, echoing the city's industrial past.

name: The Golden Forum
description: A luxurious and technologically advanced arena in Houston, designed for high-profile events and a refined audience.

name: Sunshine Coliseum
description: An open-air arena in Orlando, featuring a vibrant, energetic atmosphere perfect for family-friendly wrestling shows.

name: Pirate's Cove Arena
description: A themed arena in Tampa, embracing the city's pirate heritage with a rowdy, buccaneer-like crowd.

name: Liberty Bell Center
description: A modern indoor arena in Philadelphia, paying homage to the city's revolutionary history while hosting fierce wrestling battles.

name: Maple Leaf Gardens
description: A legendary historic arena in Toronto, preserving the grit and glory of classic Canadian wrestling.

name: Bellator Arena
description: A modern, multi-purpose arena in Edmonton, known for its passionate fans and electrifying atmosphere during combat sports events.

name: The Colossus of Rhodes
description: A colossal open-air arena in a modern Greek city, inspired by ancient wonders and hosting epic wrestling spectacles.
